Description: Head of Maximinus II Daia, laureate, right. (obverse)
Sol, radiate, draped, standing front, head left, raising right hand and holding head of Serapis up in left. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Bibliographic references: PCR / Principal coins of the Romans: Volume I: The Republic c. 290 - 31 BC; Volume II: The Principate 31 BC - AD 296; Volume III: The Dominate AD 294 - 498. (1278)
RIC6 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 6: from Diocletian's reform (AD 294) to the death of Maximinus (AD 313) (96, p.677) (type)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Maximinus II
